FOUND IN: Cumann na mBan: Founded in 1914 during the Easter Rising as a paramilitary organization that provided support to the Irish Volunteers and later evolved into an all-women's auxiliary of the Irish Republican Army, before becoming a nonpartisan women's service association post-independence.

CLUE: Of food, bought for eating elsewhere (4-4)

FOUND IN: Sweet, steaming cocoa (for hot beverages like cocoa on cool evenings).
Scimitar: A type of curved sword originating from the Middle East, often associated with Islamic cultures.
